laws.summary: Non-competes HEAVILY RESTRICTED - very limited enforceability
laws.statute_citation: Montana Code Annotated ยง 28-2-703 to 705
requirements: Non-competes HEAVILY RESTRICTED - very limited enforceability

Montana law voids most non-compete agreements. Only enforceable when: (1) protects trade secrets, proprietary information, or customer relationships, (2) employee is key employee, officer, or agent, (3) reasonable time/scope. Courts strictly construe.
Best practice: Use confidentiality agreements instead - non-competes rarely enforceable
Action required: Remove non-compete OR ensure very narrow scope with trade secret protection only
laws.notes: Montana law voids most non-compete agreements. Only enforceable when: (1) protects trade secrets, proprietary information, or customer relationships, (2) employee is key employee, officer, or agent, (3) reasonable time/scope. Courts strictly construe.

laws.summary: Montana is NOT at-will - good cause required after probation
laws.statute_citation: Montana Wrongful Discharge from Employment Act (WDEA)
requirements: Montana is NOT at-will - good cause required after probation

Montana is ONLY state that significantly limits at-will employment. After probationary period (up to 12 months), employees can only be discharged for good cause. WDEA provides exclusive remedy for wrongful discharge.
Best practice: Montana is NOT at-will after probation - use probationary period language and good cause standards
Action required: Establish clear probationary period (up to 12 months) and good cause standards
Must have good cause for discharge after probation
laws.notes: Montana is ONLY state that significantly limits at-will employment. After probationary period (up to 12 months), employees can only be discharged for good cause. WDEA provides exclusive remedy for wrongful discharge.
